column2: She said, "Hey sleepy head, time to get up. A Navy SEAL made breakfast, and I don't think you're supposed to be late." "Aye, aye. What time is it?" She glanced at the digital clock on her nightstand. "8:10."
Sloane, with his shoulder punctured, was on another lounge. He was half delirious, and kept calling something about a chemistry lecture at 8:10.
8.10 a.m. Read book or watch video
column3: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time

column2: Cell count down to 400,000. Woke 8:10. To sleep 7:15. (Appear to have lost my watch without realising it, had to drive into town to buy another.)
